I pray for strength for all the candidates, wisdom for North Carolinians, and continued greatness   always for America. It has been a pleasure and an honor to run for United States Senator. No matter what happens tomorrow, I truly had the time of my life. With Gratitude, Jen

‚ÄúAnother turning pt., fork stuck in the rd.Time grabs u by the wrist, directs u where to go. So make the best of this test & don't ask why. It's not a question, but a lesson learned in time. It's smthng unpredictable, but in the end, it's right. I hope u had the time of ur life.‚Äù

Today, I found a website that listed political survey answers attributed to me. I‚Äôve never heard of the group, and the answers are not at all representative of my published or stated views. Be careful when doing your research. If skeptical, go to the source- reach out anytime!

Disappointed to hear about Republican leaders in NC sharing their Primary votes on social media. It may not be against the law, but it is wrong, and not representative of the values and ethics we (and they) espouse. #ncpol #ncsen
NC-one-stop voting ends at 3PM today. If you are not registered, or if you don‚Äôt want to stand in line on Tuesday, this is your moment!

We are celebrating the last day of early voting in NC with a Pre-Primary breakfast! Buttermilk pancakes with blueberries. Sloooooow cooked bacon. Fresh strawberries. And, of course, coffee. Happy voting, NC! #twittersupperclub https://t.co/EaDRIRDpGd

Savoring the last of these pre-Primary moments by answering questions of North Carolinians preparing to vote. For 14 months, I have answered the (e-)mail. All of it. Where it all started. Change the conversation, and you start changing the world. Vote.

Jen for Sen is #10!  
For those looking for me at the top of NC‚Äôs Primary Republican U.S. Senate ballot, the order on this alternate year was determined to be last names E-Z, and then A-E. So, count to ten to find Jen for Sen!

This is the face of the ONLY U.S. Senate Candidate for NC who spoke at all 14 GOP District Conventions over the past month! I keep hearing the phrase ‚Äúleaders show up‚Äù, but I think of it more as I‚Äôd never let my team down. Even w/o $$ or fancy endorsements, it‚Äôs still possible! https://t.co/44zZZx9yni

Slight correction per additional evidence: the white sample ballots in Person Cty appear to be marked ‚ÄúLocal candidates in good standing are circled. (In accordance with 2022 Plan of Organization, Person County GOP.)‚Äù If you see something, say something NC!
If anyone sees other instances, please share or reach out to me. Again, this is flagrant election manipulation before a Primary. #ncpol #ncsen

The GOP in Person Cty was reportedly told by Board of Elections officials that they could not distribute the sample ballot b/c it was on white paper- same color as actual ballot. GOP reportedly continued to distribute these sample ballots after being told to stop‚Ä¶.#ncpol #ncsen

I now have evidence that Person County GOP was also handing out pre-marked sample ballots with preferred candidates. The ballots were not marked with any funding or sponsoring org and were printed on white paper as in Moore County‚Ä¶
#ncpol #ncsen

Heard in a GOP local candidate forum in NC yesterday-‚ÄúWe need to stop measuring education by the number of brown children...‚Äù Do better. There is no context that makes this an acceptable statement from any candidate in any race. Please take voting seriously and do your research.

COVID learning loss assessments and discussions are on the table in NC. It is Q3 of the traditional school year, and no adjustments have been made to the standards that children in public schools are expected to meet this year. Is this a conversation that needs to happen soon?

Respect to those who testified about 6 January, but the BIPARTISAN commission needs to shift the focus to the leadership decisions/actions that took place. Release evidence to the public.  This is an emotional/highly-politicized event, let The People decide what they think.

To be clear - not a statement on COVID relief funding - a statement on how the public is misled about educational financial needs by focusing on burn rates for specialized money.  It's also another opportunity to highlight that we need to fix the acquisition process!

Federal money takes time to get to school bank account. This money can only be spent on certain items and in certain ways, and likely requires a contract - takes time to establish and delays outlays. This is multi-year money, so you don't HAVE (or want) to spend it all quickly.
This article is misleading, and shows the importance of understanding how government money works. More to follow in comment below. https://t.co/CWHEW0MPkk
